transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, neha. thank you for joining us today. this interview will focus on your backend engineering experience, with particular emphasis on system design, scalability, and architectural thinking. please take your time while answering.

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. thank you. ill do my best.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: lets begin with your background. can you briefly describe the kind of backend systems you have worked on so far?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have mainly worked on python-based backend applications. my work mostly involves writing apis and fixing bugs in existing systems.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats good. lets move into system design. imagine you are asked to design a backend service for a simple order management system. how would you start?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i would first create apis to handle orders and store data in the database.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain how you would design the database schema for this system?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i havent really designed database schemas myself. usually, the schema is already available.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: okay. how would your system handle a sudden increase in traffic, for example during a sale?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: im not very sure. i think the server should be strong enough to handle it.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked with concepts like horizontal scaling or load balancers?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have heard about load balancers, but i havent used them in my projects.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: how would you ensure data consistency if multiple users place orders at the same time?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: im not very clear on concurrency handling. i havent dealt with that directly.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: lets talk about caching. where would you use caching in a backend system and why?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i know caching improves performance, but i dont know exactly where to use it.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked with any message queues or asynchronous processing systems?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no, i havent worked with message queues.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: okay. moving to error handlinghow do you design error responses in apis?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i use try-except blocks, but i dont follow a specific error response structure.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: finally, can you explain how you would monitor the health of a backend service in production?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i havent monitored production systems myself.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you for your answers, neha. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions. thank you for the discussion.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, neha. well reach out to you regarding the next steps.
